locutie.beschrijving: The preacher correlates a 1983 New Yorker article about Martin Luther King Jr. with the prophecy of Amos, focusing on the themes of social justice and the sovereignty of God.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. The preacher correctly identifies Amos's historical context and the 'double theme' of justice and theophanic power.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting historical and theological truths, with a late shift toward promising and questioning.
voorbeelden: Amos was a prophet in Israel in the eighth century B.C.
The source of transformation is God.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the congregation from a sense of 'loss' and 'famine of the word' to a realization of God's present power for social action.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Moderate. The Holy Spirit is mentioned as the animator of prophets, but the Spirit's current work in the hearing is implied rather than invoked.

voorbeelden: Amos’s message was not a pleasant one.
The New Yorker article does not mention the prophet Amos.
Israel’s religion had become one of self-love.
Prepare to meet your God, O Israel!
Take away from me the noise of your songs.
Look at the roll call of the heroes.
Can you share with me, then, my astonishment...
I was forcibly struck by a theme...
He cannot and will not tolerate injustice.
God ends with a promise of restoration and blessing... for you.
commissieven.kwaliteit: The promises are largely descriptive of God's character (Assertive-leaning) rather than direct first-person divine pledges to the hearer.

voorbeelden: This is the gospel; this is the good news.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher relies on the authority of the 'Word' but rarely uses the 'I declare to you' formula.

indicatoren: Extensive quoting of the New Yorker article.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a historical/sociological comparison rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Intellectual agreement without the 'event' of being addressed by God.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: General and third-person until the very end.
voorbeelden: a promise of restoration and blessing for sinful, disobedient Israel

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Preacher's personal journey and study process ('I was struck').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the congregation, mostly in the final three paragraphs.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Talking about Amos, MLK, the New Yorker writer, and 'the people'.

foutief_patroon.probleem: The sermon avoids legalism (Directive surplus) but falls into 'Information surplus'.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The move from the 'famine of the word' (Assertive) to the 'promise of restoration' (Commissive) at the end.
voorbeelden: We are all 'the undeserving poor'... this is the good news.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition is late, making the 'event' feel like a conclusion rather than the substance.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Having known this love... is there any one of us who cannot now go forth?

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions primarily as a high-level theological and social commentary. It 'talks about' the Word of God as a power, but only 'performs' that power in the final moments.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The connection between the 'famine of the word' and the 'loss of voice' in the New Yorker.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Amos spoke... Amos revealed... Amos sounds...
zwakke_punten.probleem: Keeps the biblical text in the 8th century B.C.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event only in the final 'And now hear this' section.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher describes the 'means of grace' (the Word) more than he employs it as a present-tense instrument.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is described as the speaker in the past (through Amos).
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acknowledges the role ('or else we preachers could not stand'), but acts more as a reporter.
tekstueel_bewijs: Amos spoke of the experience of being overmastered by the Word of God.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, as the animator of prophets.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicit in the 'May it be so' closing.
tekstueel_bewijs: The Holy Spirit that animated Amos and the other prophets tells us.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon identifies the Word as the source of change, but the sermon itself is a 'talk about' that source.
tekstueel_bewijs: The Word of God—that is the power behind fundamental change.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from 'Amos said' (Assertive) to 'God says to you' (Commissive/Declarative).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Amos’s message from God to the people of Israel was that their worship was a sham.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: God declares to us today: your worship is a sham if your heart is hardened.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from historical report to present-tense address.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is buried in a description of how the book of Amos ends.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Directly apply the 'restoration' to the specific 'famines' of the current congregation.
voorbeeldzinnen: To you who wander seeking a word: God promises he will not remain silent.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use the 'You' of the Amos quotes to address the 'You' in the pews.
voorbeeldzinnen: You have built houses of hewn stone—God is speaking to your lifestyle, not just Israel's.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually good, but both are too constative.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A brilliant intellectual synthesis that needs more 'fire in the bones' to move from a lecture about the Word to the event of the Word.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies that the preacher isn't just sending 'information' about justice, but is the 'mandatary' through whom God acts.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The focus is not on the 'New Yorker' illustration's cleverness, but on whether the 'Lion has roared' in the room.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's 'constative surplus' (talking about MLK and Amos) actually delays the 'sacramental event' until the very last paragraph.

commissief: He cannot and will not tolerate

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Yahweh was declaring himself to be sickened by the worship.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Informative but lacks the 'bite' of a present declaration.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The source of transformation is God.
This is the gospel; this is the good news.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Episcopal/Mainline' homiletics: high literary quality and strong social concern, but structurally reliant on constative reporting. The 'event' is deferred to the very end.
